intro: Chrysocephalum semipapposum subsp. asperum, commonly known as the rough everlasting, is a perennial herb native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant features hairy, rough-textured leaves that are typically gray-green in color. Its flowers are arranged in compact, rounded heads and bloom in spring and summer. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its drought tolerance and long-lasting flowers.
